generated.title: GeneratedIonizationEnergy
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'IonizationEnergy'

description*.en: "Ionization Energy" is the energy difference between an electron at rest at infinity and an electron at a certain energy level. The amount of energy required to remove an electron from that atom or molecule in the gas phase.

title: IonizationEnergy
description: "Ionization Energy" is the energy difference between an electron at rest at infinity and an electron at a certain energy level. The amount of energy required to remove an electron from that atom or molecule in the gas phase.
